content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

### Count & Layers:
The target structure consists of 7 blocks arranged in what appears to be 4 layers:
- Bottom layer: Green horizontal rectangular block
- Second layer from bottom: Yellow vertical rectangular block on the left side and red cube on the right side
- Third layer from bottom: Blue cube on the right side
- Top layer: Green horizontal rectangular block on top and red cube below the green block on the right side

### Spatial Relationships:
- The bottom and top green rectangular blocks form a frame-like structure
- A vertical yellow rectangular block runs along the left side between the top and bottom green blocks
- On the right side, there are three cubes stacked vertically: red (bottom), blue (middle), and red (top)
- The structure forms a rectangular tower with green blocks at the top and bottom, yellow on the left side, and a column of red-blue-red cubes on the right

## Selecting Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the analysis, I need the following blocks:
- 2 green horizontal rectangular blocks (similar to block #6 or #11)
- 1 yellow vertical rectangular block (similar to block #14 or #15)
- 2 red cubes (similar to block #4)
- 1 blue cube (similar to block #1)

Looking at the exact orientations in the dictionary:
- For the green horizontal blocks at top and bottom: Block #11 matches
- For the yellow vertical block on the left side: Block #14 matches
- For the red cubes: Block #4 matches
- For the blue cube: Block #1 matches

## Selected Blocks:
- Block #11 (green horizontal rectangle) - used twice
- Block #14 (yellow vertical rectangle)
- Block #4 (red cube) - used twice
- Block #1 (blue cube)

## Assembly Order

{
   Step1: Move block with index 11
   Step2: Move block with index 14
   Step3: Move block with index 4
   Step4: Move block with index 1
   Step5: Move block with index 4
   Step6: Move block with index 11
}
